name: fleet
content:
fleet noun [C]
(SHIPS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 a group of ships, or all of the ships in a country's navy: fleet of a fleet of 20 sailing ships a fishing fleet The entire Spanish fleet was defeated within 6 hours.
StocktrekImages/StocktrekImages/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe Allied fleet is on its way to the Gulf.The British fleet came under attack by enemy aircraft.A fleet of fishing boats was blocking the entrance to the port.Two destroyers will join the Russian fleet.The attack destroyed almost half of the U.S. fleet.

all the ships in the navy of a country, or a number of ships operating as a unit within a navy
fleet noun [C]
(VEHICLES)
a number of aircraft, buses, cars, or other vehicles under the control of one company or organization: He owns a fleet of taxis.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a number of cars, buses, planes, etc. under the control of one person or organization: The company has around 1000 buses in its fleet. a fleet of 20 corporate jets a vehicle/aircraft/bus fleet car rental fleets
a group of boats or ships travelling together: a fleet of yachts
